Description: Conical foot sherd of Chian pottery chalice; white slip; exterior: glazed black (partly worn); underside reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The bottom of the foot is quite wide and the curvature suggests that it was probably tall and narrowed towards the top; such feet are typical of the Mature Animal Style and Grand Style, and is found on some Chalice Style chalices.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0694) (phase 2)
